author: sky.cactus
content: Lets say Alice, Bob, and Carol have a ZK STARK/SNARK contract that the two of them know the code for, but it isn't published publicly.  There is an on-chain verifier that has the root/hash (or whatever it is called) of the contract so either Alice, Bob, Carol is capable of generating a proof, but no one else is because they don't have the code.  Lets further assume that Alice, Bob, and Carol all have individual secrets (e.g., private keys).

author: sky.cactus
content: *Is there a mechanism by which one can make it so the only way for any of those three to prove that the contract with the root/hash in the on-chain verifier is for them to *also* reveal their individual secret?*

author: sky.cactus
content: The goal here is to make it so the contract is a private contract between the three parties, but if any of the three parties were to make the contract public it would reveal which of them betrayed the privacy agreement.  Bonus points if the party who leaked the code can be proven on-chain so they could be punished in some kind of staking game.
